Two bibliography entries

References

Díaz, Iván, Katherine L Hoffman, and Nima S. Hejazi. 2022. “Causal Survival Analysis Under Competing Risks Using Longitudinal Modified Treatment Policies.” arXiv. https://doi.org/10.48550/ARXIV.2202.03513.
Díaz, Iván, Nicholas Williams, Katherine L. Hoffman, and Edward J. Schenck. 2021. “Nonparametric Causal Effects Based on Longitudinal Modified Treatment Policies.” Journal of the American Statistical Association, September, 1–16. https://doi.org/10.1080/01621459.2021.1955691.
*Gómez-Escobar, Luis G., Katherine L. *Hoffman, Justin J. Choi, Alain Borczuk, Steven Salvatore, Sergio L. Alvarez-Mulett, Manuel D. Galvan, et al. 2021. “Cytokine Signatures of End Organ Injury in COVID-19.” Scientific Reports 11 (1): 12606. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-021-91859-z.
Hoffman, Katherine L., Edward J. Schenck, Michael J. Satlin, William Whalen, Di Pan, Nicholas Williams, and Iván Díaz. 2022. “Corticosteroids in COVID-19: Optimizing Observational Research Through Target Trial Emulations.” medRxiv. https://doi.org/10.1101/2022.05.27.22275037.
*Price, David R., Elisa *Benedetti, Katherine L. Hoffman, Luis Gomez-Escobar, Sergio Alvarez-Mulett, Allyson Capili, Hina Sarwath, et al. 2022. “Angiopoietin 2 Is Associated with Vascular Necroptosis Induction in Coronavirus Disease 2019 Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome.” The American Journal of Pathology 192 (7): 1001–15. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ajpath.2022.04.002.
Price, David R., Katherine L. Hoffman, Clara Oromendia, Lisa K. Torres, Edward J. Schenck, Mary E. Choi, Augustine M. K. Choi, Rebecca M. Baron, Jin-Won Huh, and Ilias I. Siempos. 2021. “Effect of Neutropenic Critical Illness on Development and Prognosis of Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome.” American Journal of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine 203 (4): 504–8. https://doi.org/10.1164/rccm.202003-0753LE.
Price, David R., Katherine L. Hoffman, Elizabeth Sanchez, Augustine M. K. Choi, and Ilias I. Siempos. 2021. “Temporal Trends of Outcomes of Neutropenic Patients with ARDS Enrolled in Therapeutic Clinical Trials.” Intensive Care Medicine 47 (1): 122–23. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00134-020-06263-4.
Rahman, Aneela, Eva Schelbaum, Katherine Hoffman, Ivan Diaz, Hollie Hristov, Randolph Andrews, Steven Jett, et al. 2020. “Sex-Driven Modifiers of Alzheimer Risk: A Multimodality Brain Imaging Study.” Neurology 95 (2): e166–78. https://doi.org/10.1212/WNL.0000000000009781.
*Schenck, Edward J., Katherine L. *Hoffman, Clara Oromendia, Elizabeth Sanchez, Eli J. Finkelsztein, Kyung Sook Hong, Joseph Kabariti, et al. 2021. “A Comparative Analysis of the Respiratory Subscore of the Sequential Organ Failure Assessment Scoring System.” Annals of the American Thoracic Society 18 (11): 1849–60. https://doi.org/10.1513/AnnalsATS.202004-399OC.
Schenck, Edward J., Katherine L. Hoffman, Marika Cusick, Joseph Kabariti, Evan T. Sholle, and Thomas R. Campion. 2021. “Critical carE Database for Advanced Research (CEDAR): An Automated Method to Support Intensive Care Units with Electronic Health Record Data.” Journal of Biomedical Informatics 118 (June): 103789. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jbi.2021.103789.
Schenck, Edward J., Katherine Hoffman, Parag Goyal, Justin Choi, Lisa Torres, Kapil Rajwani, Christopher W. Tam, Natalia Ivascu, Fernando J. Martinez, and David A. Berlin. 2020. “Respiratory Mechanics and Gas Exchange in COVID-19–Associated Respiratory Failure.” Annals of the American Thoracic Society 17 (9): 1158–61. https://doi.org/10.1513/AnnalsATS.202005-427RL.
Torres, Lisa K., Katherine L. Hoffman, Clara Oromendia, Ivan Diaz, John S. Harrington, Edward J. Schenck, David R. Price, et al. 2021. “Attributable Mortality of Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome: A Systematic Review, Meta-Analysis and Survival Analysis Using Targeted Minimum Loss-Based Estimation.” Thorax 76 (12): 1176–85. https://doi.org/10.1136/thoraxjnl-2020-215950.
Zhang, William Z., Katherine L. Hoffman, Kristen T. Schiffer, Clara Oromendia, Michelle C. Rice, Igor Barjaktarevic, Stephen P. Peters, et al. 2021. “Association of Plasma Mitochondrial DNA with COPD Severity and Progression in the SPIROMICS Cohort.” Respiratory Research 22 (1): 126. https://doi.org/10.1186/s12931-021-01707-x.
